title: Test Plan Generator
description: Physics-based test plans from mission profile to DVP&R.
whenToUse: When you need a defensible validation plan tied to mechanisms, stressors, and reliability targets.

title: Mission Profile Builder
description: Build duty cycle and stress distributions by lifecycle phase. Clickable matrix + exports.

title: Burn-In Test Wizard
description: Design physics-based burn-in strategies to screen early-life failures. Recommends stress conditions, duration, and acceleration factors tied to intended life and failure mechanisms.
whenToUse: When screening early-life failures or accelerating infant mortality detection.

title: Vibration + Thermal Cycling Wizard
description: Build a vibration mission profile, generate accelerated PSD test profiles, and derive fixture requirements with reliability demonstration sizing.
whenToUse: When translating mission vibration and thermal profiles into accelerated qualification tests.

title: Derating Navigator
description: Apply MIL-style derating principles to electronic and mechanical components. Quantify derated margins, factors of safety, and thermal headroom, and generate compliance-ready summaries.
whenToUse: When preventing overstress failures before hardware is built or tested.

title: Arrhenius Calculator
description: Quantify thermal acceleration using the Arrhenius model. Calculate acceleration factors, equivalent life, and test durations for accelerated life testing (ALT) and design margin assessment.
whenToUse: When temperature-driven aging dominates failure risk.

title: Coffin-Manson Calculator
description: Estimate fatigue life driven by thermal cycling using the Coffin-Manson model. Ideal for solder joints, interconnects, and mechanically constrained assemblies exposed to cyclic strain.
whenToUse: When cyclic strain drive mechanical or solder fatigue.

title: Electromigration Lifetime Calculator
description: Predict microelectronics lifetime using Black's equation. Evaluate current density, temperature sensitivity, activation energy, and MTTF for design trade-offs and technology comparisons.
whenToUse: When electromigration limits IC or metallization reliability.

title: Sample Size Calculator
description: Determine required sample size, allowable failures, or achieved reliability and confidence using binomial reliability-demonstration theoryâ€”aligned with common qualification and DV requirements.
whenToUse: When planning reliability demonstration or pass/fail validation.

title: Psychrometric Calculator
description: Analyze air-moisture properties including relative humidity, wet-bulb temperature, and enthalpy. Useful for environmental testing, humidity stress analysis, and lab condition validation.
whenToUse: When chamber settings or moisture exposure affect reliability outcomes.

title: P Diagram Generator
description: Structure signals, noise factors, and design intent.
whenToUse: When defining validation scope early in the design cycle.

title: Reliability Block Diagram (RBD) Generator
description: Build system-level Reliability Block Diagrams from a simple table, analyze Series/Parallel/Hybrid architectures, compute system reliability, and export diagrams and data for design reviews.
whenToUse: When system-level reliability depends on configuration, not parts alone.

title: Bayesian Reliability Predictor (Software)
description: Estimate and update software reliability using Bayesian methods. Convert test results and failure data into predictive reliability metrics, MTTF, and release readiness insight.
whenToUse: When incorporating test or field failures into decision-making.
